name: Chance Lesser
text: Best Sushi in Tuscaloosa

name: KimE Wendt
text: Happy Spring. I got their sushi platter. Very good selection comes with ginger and Wasabi flower.

name: Jordan Walker
text: Great place to eat! Friendly staff they go above and beyond to accommodate your needs. Hibachi and sushi what more do you need will definitely eat there again 😊

name: BJ Lawrence
text: Although just opened with high traffic the meal was satisfying. Prepare for a wait during new openings.

name: Tony Stephens
text: Poor service, and the fish was not fresh. Will never eat here again

resp.text: You mad cause you got one pair of chopsticks and wanted two. Then wanted me to compensate you with more sushi. If you gonna give me one star let’s be honest about your one star attitude.

name: Don Norrell
text: It's just a mediocre Asian food. Nothing real special about it. The drawback is their salad is basically wet lettuce extremely wet lettuce. Not quite sure it's worth the money.

name: Katelyn Krueger
text: The last 3 times my family and friends went to the food establishment we almost walked out before even getting our food. 1 waitress was handling the whole restaurant. The food is good but pricey. The service just plainly sucks. Not worth it anymore. I will not go back.

name: look its lana
text: The food was decent but small portions for the cost and the service was good although the lady made a point to correct me about what I called the noodles though she knew exactly what I was talking about she told me they didn't have what I called them but they had whatever they call them. It's like, "ok I don't care what they call the noodles and don't want a lesson.. I just want them instead of rice..and i don't need an attitude about it." If it would have been portions worth the money I might go back but I'm sure by the next time I'm even in Hamilton it won't even be there.

name: Julie Jones
text: It was really good when it first opened but it has gone down hill quickly. The food is horrible now. Very dissatisfied. I thought it would get better, but it continues to be disappointing. We will not be back. The food is poorly prepared. The sauce is watered down and flavorless.

name: Kassi Ables
text: I absolutely love the food and the people. Never disappointed.

name: Sierra Reid
text: This place has really good food I recommend to anyone who likes Asian food. I got the chicken hibachi and it was amazing. 😍

name: Brigit W
text: Been here three times in the last 4 months. I’m surprised it’s still open. At lunch, there were only a couple of tables with customers other than our table. It’s like this every time we have been there and not just at lunch time. The sushi options are not your normal choices. I have not found a roll I like yet. And I love all varieties of sushi! One waitress brought me a cucumber roll and I asked for an eel and cucumber three times. Another corrects you on EVERYTHING if you say something wrong. It always takes at least 45 minutes  to get your food and like I said it’s never been crowded with us there. The food is ok. Just ok. Go to Inori instead. All their food is great!!

name: Whispering Hill Farm
text:
Sorry we wasted money on this place. New York steak tasted rancid, scallops we burnt with ice cold centers
Wait staff was very pleasant. We just finished our meal and heading for some pepto to settle our stomachs.  We lived in Japan for years and this wasn't Japanese food.

resp.text: Sorry for the bad experience! It was a rocky beginning, welcome to come back any time you'd like!

name: shelby tidwell
text: Good food just pricey

name: Darla Roberts
text: Always delicious. I have not ate anything that I didnt enjoy

name: Dominic Dwayne
text: Idk his name but he looks like a Sean. Lets call him Sean. We want sean as a waiyer eveytime. Chick we had today was slow and lame.

name: Ellyn Rosenbeck
text: horrible barely edible food.  will definitely NOT be back

name: Christine Boyd
text: It is really great place to eat.

name: Amy Willnow
text: OMG the food is amazing!!!!

name: Kimmy Vinson
text: The place was clean, the service was excellent and the food was Delicious!

name: Christine Boyd
text: It is really great place to eat.

name: Dylan Britt
text: Food was good. Service was good. Music was country. Lol. Merica.

resp.text: Thanks Dylan! Glad you enjoyed it.

name: Ellyn Rosenbeck
text: horrible barely edible food.  will definitely NOT be back

name: Jeff Morgan
text: Very clean, very good food, great staff

name: Josh Jenkins
text: Tiny sushi rolls. The waitress kept calling steamed dumplings sashimi 🙄

name: Amy Willnow
text: OMG the food is amazing!!!!

text: Good food just pricey

name: Kathy Bruchey
text: Wasn't what I thought it was going to be. The food had no flavor.

name: Rebel Red
text: Got sever food poisoning after eating there

name: Josh Jenkins
text: Tiny sushi rolls. The waitress kept calling steamed dumplings sashimi 🙄

text: The boss is rude

name: Karen McClellan
text: Employees are amazing and respectful!

name: Kathy Bruchey
text: Wasn't what I thought it was going to be. The food had no flavor.

name: Shawna Burkhart
text: LOVE THIS RESTAURANT!!!  Great food!!!

name: mike carpenter
text: Ok at best

name: Rebel Red
text: Got sever food poisoning after eating there

name: Donny Harden
text: Great food...

name: Leah Ledlow
text: Amazing food!

name: Thomas Robertson
text: Great service

name: Tammi K
text: Delicious!

name: matt geiken
text: We had dinner hear last night. Sushi was very good and well priced. They even have several dishes and special rolls for kids. The bartender was also our waitress and she was very polite and friendly. We would definite definitely go again next time we are in town.

name: Daniel Pendley
text: Great sushi- $1.25 for 3 pieces on Mondays. Great menu all around. Lunch is good deal. Some of the best Thai food in town and some very tasty pan Asian options! Wine special on Thursdays

name: ian kornmeyer
text:
Asian Rim was across from our hotel and we thought we'd give it a try.  Overall, I'm glad we went and we would go back.

We tried the fish tacos and some sushi.  The fish tacos come thoroughly doused in coleslaw and big enough to be difficult to eat without a double-jointed jaw. They were full of fresh veggies and the fish was good.  The sushi was a Rainbow Roll and some nigiri.  The fish was all fresh and the portions were appropriate for the price.

Our sweet tea came out hot enough to melt the included ice.

name: Lee Osbourn
text: If you've never eaten at Asian Rim, grab your keys and head over there!  It's a great little place with a nice atmosphere and the staff are very friendly. I usually have the Dragon's tail(i think its called). I always like to try something different when i go,  but I've never been disappointed.

name: Paige H.
text: Asian Rim is our favorite place in Birmingham, AL. They have a wide variety of delicious food where I can enjoy Thai or Sushi and my husband can delight in a juicy steak. The staff is friendly, the place is upscale casual, and it's a local hotspot near our home. Many out of town diners are pleasantly surprised that this local gem.

name: ninalita84
text: This was certainly a surprise to find in Birmingham!  I used to travel there for business and never let a trip go by without visiting this restaurant.  Their sushi is amazing and I found the service to always be prompt and attentive.

name: Jacqueline Dorris
text: We stayed at the hotel right next door and saw the reviews of this place and figured we would try it out. We were very disappointed. Food was bland and dried out. Atmosphere was a little weird (the bartender was playing something on her phone from Pandora) that was super strange and not typical of an Asian cuisine restaurant... she seemed a little spacey. I found that when comparing the prices to the quality of the food, it just didn't add up.

name: B R
text: Ive had the worst sushi I've ever tasted here, it's a shame bc we used to love this place. As a military wife we have been all over the country and I have never encountered such awful customer service after voicing my concerns about our meal. They used to be the best but have since gone down hill with the quality of their fish. The owners need to take lessons on customer service and handling criticism professionally with out taking it personally.

name: Spencer Stantis
text: Really great place serving a variety of Asian food. They have something for everyone.

name: Meliah Miranda
text: Asian Rim was FABULOUS!!!  Close to the Drury Inn.  Food was great, service was fantastic. All-in-all, we enjoyed it.

name: Ryan Hanson
text: Great services and delicious sushi. A great place to eat in a really nice restaurant.

name: Anna Harmon
text: Excellent service. Soup was amazing. Sushi was okay, not great.

name: Heather Rowell
text: One of the best dinner experiences.  Peking Duck Rolls, Macadamia Pineapple Sushi,  Salmon and Chocolate Ginger Mousse. Mmm... :)

name: Geralyn Sigler
text: Always a pleasure to eat here! GREAT food, drinks and atmosphere!

name: Parker 205
text: It was a great place but it's now closed

name: Sarah Smith
text: Pretty good Asian restaurant for Birmingham. They have good lunch specials.

name: abbie t
text:
Asian Rim, specifically the manager Colton, turned what was supposed to be a relaxing dinner with my family into a three hour nightmare. It was failure after failure, and I have never before been subjected to such poor customer service.  That’s the short version.

This is the full story. I ordered (and paid for) delivery from Asian Rim through Yelp Eat24 and, after waiting an hour and a half without getting any food or as much as a phone call, I called the restaurant directly to ask when I could expect my meal. I was informed by Colton that there was no order because they don’t associate with Yelp Eat24 at all. Understandably, this freaked me out and lead me to believe I had been scammed. I then called Yelp Eat24 and demanded a refund after telling them what Colton had said. While they did quickly offer a me a refund (which –side note-- I won’t be getting for “up to 5 business days”), they were adamant that they did in fact work with Asian Rim and that their restaurant had actually already confirmed the order before I had called. I was still falsely placing my faith in Asian Rim at this time.

After hanging up with Yelp Eat24, I hurriedly called my bank to inform them that I might have falsely been charged. All of this was quite time consuming and anxiety inducing. On a whim, I decided to call Asian Rim back again and relay to them the information I had been given by the representative at Yelp Eat24 for their own benefit. That’s when Colton then informed me that they did actually work with Yelp Eat24 after all. He just hadn’t known a third party, Backdoor, was also involved and it was their name coming up in his system. He unapologetically told me the food I had originally ordered would be at my house shortly.

But was it? No. So after even more time elapsed, I called Asian Rim a third time to ask what was going on. I was told by a different person that I should “just try calling Backdoor.” I had to flat out demand to be told if the food had at least left Asian Rim yet. She finally said “yeah.” No apologies were given and I was rushed off the phone.

Then I called Backdoor and was told that they did pick up the food from Asian Rim, but then realized the order had been cancelled. Aside from the refund Yelp Eat24 says they will give me, no other amends have even been attempted to be made. To reiterate-- his whole ordeal lasted about 3 hours from the time I placed and paid for the order to the time I was definitively told that there was no food coming. To say this place, and Colton specifically, handled this poorly is an understatement. I adamantly advise everyone reading this to refrain from ordering from Asian Rim.

name: Aaron Gray
text: Excellent sushi here. The red dragon roll and bagel rolls are my favorite.

name: David Gibson
text: Love the Drunken Noodle here... great sushi.. never a long line at lunch...

name: carolyn wilson
text: My son took me here. I loved the sushi.

name: Austin Brooks
text: Great food, great service. Will go back with friends next time.

name: Judy Barganier
text: Best sea bass ever. Loved the lettuce wraps.

name: Barry Bailey
text: Very pleasant surprise,  great was a slow day

name: Stephanie Jackomis
text: The food was marginal at best.

name: Cam AP
text: Great food and service

name: Elizabeth Garriga
text: Tom Kha soup keeps me going back and their sushi can't be beat in the Cahaba Heights area

name: Herb Springer
text: Great sushi in a nice environment.

name: Rosanna Valentin
text: Great lunch specials!

name: Burt Chandler
text: Was great, now closed

name: Kris Clavin
text: Nothing special. Little pricey

name: Poppy Tidwell Hill
text: Great sushi, sea bass, and drunken noodles

name: Chris Carter
text: Great place to eat

name: Shane “Sandaddio” Gibbs
text: Good food

name: scoen5
text: Bravo!!!!! The food was absolutely amazing. The crab avocado and lobster appetizers were both divine! The sushi rolls were creative and so delicious! Best sushi in Birmingham hands down! The drinks were fabulous and their cold sake selection was good. The staff were all very friendly and professional. They also have a pet friendly patio seating area so we were able to bring our dog with us. If I could give them 10 stars I would. We will be visiting this restaurant often!!

name: Jacfrost most random videos! Jac
text: A1 really good it was fast the server was on point. No complaints at all. l had sushi it was filling and nice portion sizes. Oh yeah get that shrimp tempura it was bussing!!

name: Joseph Upshaw
text: Overall not a good experience. Long wait for a table even though the restaurant was half empty. I understand staffing issues beyond their control may cause that but when i made that comment to the hostess she said they were fully staffed. The waitress was a sweetheart but she had no idea about the menu or really about serving in general. One bright spot that kept me from giving them only one star was the sushi roll I ordered was pretty good. It was a ‘special roll’ not on the menu (which the waitress was unaware of and the sushi chef came to the table to explain). Charged me $27 for it. It was good but not $27 good. Unlikely to give them another try.

name: Neal Johnson
text: The food here was ok. Nothing special really about it. Some of us didn't really like the food but the burger was a solid option. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again but wouldn't outright refuse to go back.

name: Shane P
text: The food was good. Tapas style menu. Service was friendly, just a little slow. Nice seating options, we sat by a large open window facing outdoors with a good breeze. They also have bar and outdoor seating, as well as regular indoor table seating. The coconut soup is delicious.

name: Nancy Davis
text: Congratulations👏 What a great new place with wonderful food and NO MSG. Thank you for putting so much care into our food❣

name: Channing Morris
text:
Was okay right after opening, but quickly went downhill.  The food is between mediocre and okay and the prices are quite high for the quality.

There's better food on the block and better sushi in Birmingham for less money.

name: Kristina Tanner
text: Great new spot in Birmingham for sushi! Large open windows give it a nice atmosphere, delicious food, and great service. We had Riley as our server who was excellent and made great recommendations.

name: Caroline Doughty
text: Best sushi in bham! My friends and I wandered in late one night and enjoyed everything! From the cocktails to food to atmosphere, everything was 10/10. Food tasted super fresh. I got the Lakeview roll and a ginger salad, it was filling and full of flavor.

name: Christy Vest
text: Fantastic food, fantastic service, fantastic aesthetic. Came here not knowing it was opening night, and was thoroughly impressed. The pork belly taco, caiparinha sushi roll, and London’s Calling cocktail were particular standouts. Do yourself a favor and come here.

name: Vasilios Tsantes
text: Great experience! Love the tapas style part of the menu so you can try different dishes at a fair prices. Steak and Ahi tuna tacos were packed  with flavor, scallops were perfectly cooked, Hokkaido potatoes were crisp with a great taste, fried octopus was a hit(I'll have 2 next time) and fried Brussel sprouts were impressive. Being the 3rd day it's been open the staff was strong and pleasant. Looking forward to our next visit.

name: Ashley Robinson
text: This place has been open less than a month and my friend and I were excited by the concept. Went there around 8:50 on a Tuesday night and they were not busy at all. The hostess was quite happy to tell us that they were closed early despite the online and door posting of a closing time of 10pm. When I asked why she referred me to some excuse riddled supervisor whining about their GM quiting them high and dry abruptly and them not being able to run very well as a result. As a former restaurant manager I can say this place is a disaster.

name: Curtis Coen
text: Great experience. Everything is fresh, tasty, and aesthetically pleasing. Kobe bone marrow burger was excellent 👌

name: Alice Anastasia Glass
text: Best. Sushi. In. Town. Seriously, I think between everyone in my party, we ordered about 36 different rolls, and they were rach more amazing than the last. Plus, it's a beautiful space and the staff is fantastic. I cannot recommend Umatilla highly enough. Get in there!!!

name: Alex Reiner
text: Some of the best sushi, if not the best in Birmingham. Will be going back as often as possible. Drinks, service, and management were also fantastic.

name: Jackson Hankins
text: Felt like the food was super fresh and very reasonably priced for the quality of food that we received. Highly recommend the Beef Rendang and Cripsy rice appetizer! I like that it is tapa style so you can try a variety of items. Overall great food, and a great experience.

name: Tyler Cummings
text: This place is stellar. I’ve never even eaten here, but because I live above it and they can give me sushi quicker than Gotye’s music career it gets five stars.

name: Benjamin Glover
text: The sushi is fantastic. The fish was fresh and the service was great.

name: Matt Scarola
text: Loved the rolls and nigiri. Friendly staff

name: Doug Grabarczyk
text: The food is outstanding and varied.

name: wilbur cornner
text: Great people and service....

name: John Grady Welden
text: Great environment and great food.

name: Nicholas Smith
text: The sushi is amazing.

name: Bennie Adams
text: Excellent food and service

name: Masafumi Hirata
text: So good! I usually don't expect good food at mall, but this place is better than the other Pho places!

name: Kai-ning H
text: I come here whenever I can. I love authentic Asian food and Viet Kitchen is one of the asian restaurant I really like. It's my go to place whenever I come shopping at Galleria.

name: Ying Hu
text: The order was instant!! Took the chef 1 minute to put the pho on the counter! Very fresh!

name: Hannah Courtney
text: Took one bite and my life flashed before my eyes.  I’m so sad that I’m only here for the weekend, because this food is so good that I’m going to be dreaming of it when I leave :(((( delicious!!!

name: KBNJB _
text: Best sushi in all man kind

name: Jimmy K
text: Bomb roll fried and yum yum chicken! Really really good!

name: Michael Daw
text: Absolutely amazing and astonishingly fresh!

name: Rayne Alexis Butler (Raven Blackheart)
text: My favourite restaurant! The food is always delicious and the service is outstanding. You never feel judged here as everyone is welcome in this chill rock n roll based sushi restaurant.

name: Martella Owes
text: One ☝️ of my favorite places to go and grab delicious 😋 sushi 🍣 service is always good!!

name: Vicki Gray
text: I enjoy this place and its staff, we make point to go to this location bc of them.

name: Jamika Black
text: The was my first experience at Rock n Roll sushi. I ordered the Heart Roll. It was the most delicious roll I've ever eaten. Well worth the money.

name: Klassy Pearl
text: I enjoyed sitting at the bar and eating the Heart roll. It was delicious

name: Megan Bennett
text: If I could give this place a zero stars I would!!! Waited an hour and a half for food and it was horrible and cold. There was no sympathy from the staff at all. They did not care at all. Brought out my food first, 30 mins before my husbands and never brought his out when we left. Pick another rock and roll bc this one has poor management and terrible customer service

name: Dawnisha Massey
text: Food was great. Service was great. Price is right. I love the fact that it is a cozy little spot off the beaten path. I had the heart roll and wontons and they were amazing. Moat definitely will be visiting again.

name: Mara Osuna Suarez (Kastor)
text: Great ambience, friendly, professional, quick and attentive service and most of everything great food for a great price. It is a definitive must come back for us. It's hot food that is super filling and delicious.

name: Andrea Robinson
text: Awesome experience, great atmosphere, friendly service, delicious food

name: Tony Sylvest
text: This is just a fun place to hang out, eat Sushi, and listen to some music that you haven't heard in a long time. It kind of turns into a almost game show atmosphere with some people, as they try and identify the artists and songs that they haven't heard in what seems like forever, sometimes, while other times, it's like listening to the voice of a long lost friend, who's come around for a long overdue visit. If you're lucky enough to have Brittany taking care of you, you'll have a friend for life.

name: Rebekah C
text: The sushi was amazing I got a Metallica roll and a sweet home Alabama roll (fried)

name: Jennifer Carter
text: Good sushi and good drinks, definitely coming back.

name: Ana Thema
text: Le SIGH. Brought my daughter here for a birthday lunch, server was very rude until she heard me complain about her attitude. Definitely be thankful you have a job would be my advice. Being rude to customers is crazy when just a few weeks ago almost everything was closed. I hope you enjoy your tip you were left. :)

name: Darlene Lewis
text: I always enjoy coming to this location. Great service and food!

name: Chris Hudson
text: First time eating there.  Nice quiet place and friendly staff

name: Kyra Reid
text: Always a great choice for sushi! The Michael Jackson roll is my go to favorite, not to mention its the Monday special, so bonus! I tried the Beatles roll for the first time and it was awesome! It took just a minute to take our drink order, but it looked like there were a few people waiting on take out orders, so we didn't mind waiting just a minute. I never would have thought to get take out sushi, but I think I've been missing out?? Cause that sounds like a fantastic idea! We'll most definitely be back. The atmosphere is cool and the music is awesome. Staff is always friendly and as always, the food continues to impress!

name: Brian Carberry
text: A little on the  $$$ side, but food is always awesome

name: Ramona Pierce
text: It was awesome.

name: Jason North
text: Waitress was very nice and excellent. Food was so delicious and full of flavor. Drinks was on key. If you have a lady offer the girls girls girls drink. my wife loved it. Thank you ROCK N ROLL SUSHI. WE had a wonderful time.

name: David Clay
text: Under new management but still the best sushi 🍣

name: Bonnie Branson
text: Although the food was good the waitresses are never friendly whenever I go in there.

name: Samantha Roberson
text: Great service. First time eating there the waiter walked me through the menu offered suggestions and took my order. The chef was prompt and very nice and didn't complain about alterations I asked for. The food was amazing!

name: Regan Miller
text: I come in to this specific location at least once a week. The food is always AMAZING and so is the service! CUSTOMER FOR LIFE!!!!!!!!

name: Jackie Brothers
text: Always delicious, friendly and attentive.

name: Tiffany Black
text: Great food

name: tiffany s
text: Love Love Love best place and location for Sushi in Mobile. The girl that is always there on the Sushi bar works clean  neat, and efficient makes them bomb.

name: Сергей Овчаренко
text: Super perfect!!🍜 Very tasty, good service🙂

name: Frank Rodriguez
text: The food was very good

name: David Godsey
text: Awesome food and service as always.

name: Rich Touart
text: So much rock, so much fun

name: Dereck Clemons
text: I went in tonight after work, sat at the bar for 10 mins before anyone greeted me or said anything  to me. I finally placed my order I was never asked if I wanted something to drink. I asked for a drink menu and the server never came back to take my order. The server was not friendly at all. Maybe she was having a bad night. Horrible Service Tonight.

name: Gabrielle Hampton
text: Food was amazing and staff very attentive and professional. Prices are very decent. Atmosphere is great. Everything is great. Thank you.

name: Joshua Wafer
text: Food has been good every time I've been there. Service is usually just as awesome. They're a bit on the pricey side but still enjoyable. I have not left there disappointed yet.

name: Richard Porter
text: I got told at 9:35 I couldn’t order on phone so I pull in at 9:43 and others was getting there to go food. I was told owners turn away business at 9:45 on Saturday night. The manager that night rude and not helpful. If you advertise to 10 don’t turn away before that.If you close at 9:45 advertise that!

name: Berry Chestnut
text: OMG the food is always on point!! I mean from the drinks to the staff it's the best one in the city

name: Raynita Lewis
text: Sooooo delicious😋✨ good customer service and the food is amazing and fresh! Sooooo delicious. By far the best jalapeno poppers that I have ever had. I got a "Bama Roll", it was so good. I forgot to get a picture, sorry. Miso was also very tasty. Hubby had the "Heart Roll" which was also very delicious.

name: Jamal Windham
text: Great food and great service

name: Melissa Sullivan
text: Lobe this place. Go there as often as posdible. THE GIRLS GIRLS GIRLS is awesome!!

name: Jamal Windham
text: Great food and great service

name: Dave Roberts
text: The food was really good.  There are some pricey options but there are plenty of affordable ones as well.  Service was good too, and the food came out quickly.  The menu and interior decor show lots of love to rock culture, but I would've added a little more to the tip if they would've showed some love for Sting and The Police.  C'mon, Don't Stand So Close To Me?  Synchronicity II?  Message in a Bottle?  Let's not forget that Stewart Copeland is arguably the best rock drummer of all time next to Neil Peart.  Anyway, we dug it.   Give it a try.

name: Shelby Shaw
text: Service wasn’t too great and they completely destroyed our order. I’m willingly to give this location another shot, but unfortunately my dad can’t shake it. I will say the other location was a lot better!

name: Melissa Sullivan
text: Lobe this place. Go there as often as posdible. THE GIRLS GIRLS GIRLS is awesome!!

name: Southern Girl
text: We arrived here at 12:01 (Apple Watch time, which is globally recognized) today and stood outside in the rain for 5 minutes waiting on the woman inside to open the doors and let us in. She kept walking back and forth from behind the counter, seemingly doing nothing important and she definitely saw my family outside the glass windows and doors waiting. We finally got in our vehicle to go at 12:07 and another family walked up and we saw that she still wouldn’t open the doors. Perhaps this establishment should fix their clocks. The door clearly said that the business opened at 12:00 on Sundays. They lost 2 families worth of business within 10 minutes time because of a LAZY employee. We live in mobile and will never return here.

name: Carla Sirmon
text: I love this place! The food is always fresh and they have great service.

name: Melissa Morton
text: Sushi was good. Service was good. Did not like having to request for 2 plates, (since sushi rolls were served on 1 plate) and there was 2 of us. Also, didn't think our server should have checked her phone 5+ times during our 30 minute lunch. She was overall a good server. She may have just overlooked the plate issue, but cell phones should be kept in the back. One more note: she took a fellow table's order at the computer/posi about 15 feet away from the table. If that would have been myself, I would have walked out. She should have taken their order at the table. I'm in the restaurant business and it offended me, hopefully the fellow table didn't notice.

name: Jennifer Carden
text: This place was amazing! The service was great and the sushi was deliciously different than anywhere I've had it in a long time! Creative with a lot of flavor!  I recommend the Asian Boom Boom Shrimp, the Tommy Lee roll, the Heart roll, the saki, and the Adult Ice Cream!

name: delilah bryant
text: Love their sushi and great customer service.

name: Bulls On Parade
text: First experience here and the sushi was amazing. Can't wait to take the wife! ROCK ON!

name: April McLeod
text: Because it's kitschy AND delicious!

name: Brandon Slade
text: One of my favorite places for consistent sushi with several locations. The staff is always friendly and the sushi always fresh. Geared more towards the younger crowd. Pricing is slightly higher than that of some competitors. My fiance and I agree the Cindy Lauper is a must and for fried or baked the Heart roll.

name: Bulls On Parade
text: First experience here and the sushi was amazing. Can't wait to take the wife! ROCK ON!

name: Kellie “Leaora” Jones
text: Ladies night rocked!

name: Kennedy Edwards
text: The food was good and he atmosphere was neat. It was kind of pricey but the specialty rolls are unique so I suppose that warrants a higher tag. I will probably be using their takeout service in the future

name: douglas fulford
text: Awesome people and awesome food

name: Michael Coleman
text: Very good sushi me and my daughter had a wonderful time

name: Melanie Ferguson
text: Great service, excellent wine & sushi, fresh and artistically presented. Don't stop! Thanks, melanie

name: Catherine Vo Steiner
text: Food is pretty good. They need to hire more help!!! And servers should not wear tank tops.....GROSS!

name: Ryan Beverly
text: Can't say enough about this place. Love , love, love sushi and this place delivers. Pretty much can't go wrong with any roll and the jalapeño poppers are easily the best appetizer there. Also the drinks are good but no where near the highlight like the sushi is.

name: Cyndi Thomas
text: Fast and fresh! They slice the fresh tuna to order in front of you.

name: Catherine Vo Steiner
text: Food is pretty good. They need to hire more help!!! And servers should not wear tank tops.....GROSS!

name: Sidney Banks
text: Good food friendly service nice atmosphere

name: Yaz Castillo
text: Food  it's good but more small...

name: Tree Goddess
text: I love the food and it's a great atmosphere

name: Jonathan Greer
text: This is a great local chain for sushi! From the  music and decor to the items on the menu everything is rock and roll themed. This specific one is a cozy off the main road place to eat.  The crispy wontons are the best crab wontons I've ever had.

name: Ryan Beverly
text: Can't say enough about this place. Love , love, love sushi and this place delivers. Pretty much can't go wrong with any roll and the jalapeño poppers are easily the best appetizer there. Also the drinks are good but no where near the highlight like the sushi is.

name: Meaghan Gates
text: The food is so yummy!

name: Karen Weaver
text: #1 sushi in place in Mobile as far as Im concerned. I prefer the one off Airport and Azalia.

name: Zoe squad
text: BEST sushi u can get in Alabama it’s very high quality and a very good environment I really do recommend coming here and trying there food my favorite is the kiss roll and the gun down roll 😋 very delightful there rice is very good I also go here a lot never had a problem with the stuff 😊 raw sushi very good to  definitely the one with salmon

name: Karen Weaver
text: #1 sushi in place in Mobile as far as Im concerned. I prefer the one off Airport and Azalia.

name: MS. B
text: Shrimp 🍤 🍤 hibachi was bomb! Also got the fried cheesecake to go. So good!

name: Lynette Keith
text: Service was horrible.  Seated us at a table that was not clean so I asked the waitress to wipe it down for us and I guess she got mad because we sat there for 15 minutes before the manager came and asked us what we wanted to drink.  Once our food came about 45 minutes later no one checked on us again…no drink refills.  The sushi was wonderful and almost worth the crappy service.  We will try another location next time.

resp.text: We're so sorry to hear about your bad experience, we take great pride in our food and service and want everyone to leave happy. Can you email your contact information to RocknRollSushi_Tuscaloosa@yahoo.com for a manager to contact you? Again we apologize!

name: vera bettin
text: Nice people but the sushi is weak and very Americanized, it looked good and smelled fresh, but it had no taste and too many cheap fillers like cream cheese yuk! The people get nice thou.

name: Loren Deagro
text: Service and food was great!

name: 4lona2
text: I loved it! There's something there for everyone, even the beginner. I wish we had a Rock N Roll Sushi in Columbus, GA.

name: Jay Sirichan
text: Good food. Crab wonton is good. Service is good.

name: Heide King
text: Excellent prices and lots to choose from. Always friendly and understanding of celiac, they go out of their way to make sure it is safe for me to eat there.

name: Jordan Dennis
text: Sushi is good. Good prices.

name: Meghan Andrasik Kazmi
text:
Horrible SERVICE and Quality of food.
Complained, but no manager on duty. Chef "Tham" cyssed me out in background.  WILL NEVER, EVER, EVER EAT THERE AGAIN!

text: some if the best sushi I've had in the gulf coast for sure.

text: Excellent prices and lots to choose from. Always friendly and understanding of celiac, they go out of their way to make sure it is safe for me to eat there.

name: George Singleton
text: Great Food and our waitress Courtney was super awesome! Excellent music too!

name: Scott Middleton
text: Better now that it isn't cramped in a small place in the mall! Food is great too.

name: vvonder woman
text: It was friday afternoon delight before valentines day, only day husband and I had off for holiday so we splurged and went here for our "romantic luncheon" when we walked in place wasn't very busy, we were given ample time to decide in what we wanted, our 1st time here tv's were playing on mute music video's but we didn't get to hear any rock and roll the whole time we were there, waitress didn't talk much to us or help out they were on phones pretty much whole time we were there, we had to ask for everything, the girl behind the bar kept blurting out an extremely loud laugh that scared me a couple times, food was real good, fun, and tasty, our bill reasonably priced for what we got  we ordered over 50$  worth and enjoyed ourselves in our own little world, we tipped the waitress well because we felt sorry for her but I doubt we'll go back to this one.

name: Dustin Denney
text: Great sushi!

name: Luke Thomsen
text: The sushi was poor at best i could by better stuff at half the cost.  My wife couldnt order any entries from the menu.  The gumbo was just a beef stew.  Go somewhere else

name: Chelsea Madren (OC Food Diva)
text: Chef Chris makes a Lionfish Roll that is truly beautiful to behold. The lionfish sashimi on top is very delicate and translucent. It has a sweet flavor and silky texture. I have never had a piece of sashimi quite like this before! He uses purple Thai sticky rice and it adds a nutty flavor, very different from Calrose rice normally used in sushi. The roll also had pork belly inside which gave each bite just the right amount of salt and added a smoky flavor. Instead of seaweed, a yuzu wrap was used and added a citrus flavor without being overwhelming. I can wait to go back in November and have another one! Rating: 5/5

name: Clayton E. Linkous III
text: Great selection of sushi and personal service the staff provided.

name: Ryan Meisemann
text: I wish I could go lower. Sushi was worst than Winn Dixie  sushi and the service was worst than the food. Don't go.
